title.narrative: UNICEF Education Support in the North - Phase 2

description.narrative: Funding under this initiative supports the Education Sector in Conflict-affected Areas in Northern Sri Lanka - Phase 2. It supports the reconstruction or repair of 17 prioritised schools damaged through prolonged conflict in Sri Lanka's Northern Province. Funding is via a single grant payment to United Children's Fund (UNICEF) (who is the cluster lead-agency) for responding to education needs in the north) to oversee the repair or rebuild of the 17 schools to internationally accepted standards. These schools have been prioritised through a joint process between UNICEF and the Government of Sri Lanka (GoSL). The project will rehabilitate school buildings to UNICEF's international Child Friendly Schools (CFS) standard. These schools will provide safe and durable education facilities for approximately 8,400 children in marginalised and conflict-affected communities in the north. The total value of this initiative is $7.2 million over 4 years, starting 2010-11.
